title.narrative: Building Inclusive Security in Central African Republic

description.narrative: Prevent violent conflict in high-risk areas by providing civilians with on-going, structured horizontal and vertical communication mechanisms that address local security issues, and to build capacity of national legislative representatives to advocate for their constituents needs and provide legislative oversight to the Disarmament, Demobilization, Reintegration, and Reconciliation/Security Sector Reform. Managed by Bureau of African Affairs, Office of Security Affairs (AF/SA). Funds obligated by United States Institute of Peace.

title.narrative: Strengthening Government Ability to Hold Perpetrators Accountable for Conflict-Related Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (GBV) in the Central African Republic

description.narrative: Drawing upon more than 20 years of experience assisting tribunals prosecuting serious international crime, American University College of Law project staff are providing training, research tools, and technical assistance in support of prosecutors and civil societys efforts to prevent and respond to the widespread sexual and gender-based violence that has occurred during recent conflicts in the Central African Republic.
